CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many series are represented in this stream chart?

SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing Chronic Condition Patients relative to Emergency Room Patients?
SRP.A: Chronic Condition Patients is {below} Emergency Room Patients in the vertical direction.

SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing Wellness Program Participants relative to Emergency Room Patients?
SRP.A: Wellness Program Participants is {below} Emergency Room Patients in the vertical direction.

SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing Pediatric Patients relative to Emergency Room Patients?
SRP.A: Pediatric Patients is {below} Emergency Room Patients in the vertical direction.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the largest portion to the total patient satisfaction?
VPR.A: The series with the largest contribution is {Wellness Program Participants}.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the smallest portion to the total patient satisfaction?
VPR.A: The series with the smallest contribution is {Emergency Room Patients}.

EVJ.Q: Which year is Emergency Room Patients's maximum Patient Satisfaction in the streamgraph?
EVJ.A: Emergency Room Patients's maximum Patient Satisfaction is in {1957}.

EVJ.Q: Which year is Pediatric Patients's minimum Patient Satisfaction in the streamgraph?
EVJ.A: Pediatric Patients's minimum Patient Satisfaction is in {1962}.

NC.Q: Was the total Patient Satisfaction in 1970 higher or lower than in 1980?
NC.A: The total patient satisfaction in 1970 was {higher} than in 1980.

NC.Q: Was the total Patient Satisfaction in 1977 higher or lower than in 1982?
NC.A: The total patient satisfaction in 1977 was {higher} than in 1982.

NC.Q: Was the total Patient Satisfaction in 1961 higher or lower than in 1983?
NC.A: The total patient satisfaction in 1961 was {higher} than in 1983.

NC.Q: Was the total Patient Satisfaction in 1965 higher or lower than in 1977?
NC.A: The total patient satisfaction in 1965 was {higher} than in 1977.

MSR.Q: In this streamgraph, which one held the dominant position for the longest period of time?
MSR.A: {Wellness Program Participants} held the dominant position for the longest period of time.

MSR.Q: In this streamgraph, in which year did Pediatric Patients and Wellness Program Participants first exchange dominant positions?
MSR.A: Pediatric Patients and Wellness Program Participants first exchanged leading positions in {1960}.
